TI: GAD-immunoreactive neurons are preserved in the hippocampus of rats with spontaneous recurrent seizures.
AB: In the present study glutamate decarboxylase immunoreactivity (GAD-IR) was used to quantify GABAergic neurons in the hippocampus of rats exhibiting spontaneous recurrent seizures following pilocarpine-induced status epilepticus. Histological examination demonstrated marked neuronal damage to hippocampal neurons. However, in the same region, GAD-IR neurons were preserved. The present data demonstrate a selective resistance of GABAergic neurons to status epilepticus-induced neuronal damage, suggesting that loss of hippocampal GABAergic neurons does not underlie the recurrence of seizures in these animals.
AD: Departamento de Neurologia e Neurocirurgia, Escola Paulista de Medicina, Sao Paulo, Brasil.
JT: Brazilian journal of medical and biological research = Revista brasileira de pesquisas medicas e biologicas
